author: R Rajaram
text:
Having been on their toes for the past 10 days to ensure security and safety of lakhs of pilgrims, police on Monday heaved a sigh of relief as the theerthavari, the main event of Mahamaham, passed off without any untoward incident.

The police went all out to ensure the safety and security of the devotees, Inspector General of Police, Central Zone N.K. Senthamaraikannan told The Hindu .

The police had deployed 20,000 personnel, especially from the Armed Reserve, Special Task Force and the Tamil Nadu Special Police and installed about 400 surveillance cameras at vantage points.

Abutting the Mahamaham tank, the command centre housed a team from the Tamil Nadu Commando Force.

Thanjavur Collector N. Subbaiyan was at the command centre keeping an eye on the “live” movements on the monitors. The Inspector General of Police, Technical Services M.C. Sarangan in-charge of the command centre briefed the Collector about the measures put in place. Additional Director General of Police (Law and Order) J.K. Tripathy, who had been camping in Kumbakonam, monitored the movement of devotees in the tank.

About 20,000 personnel were deployed and about 400 surveillance cameras installed
title: Police heave a sigh of relief
